title: Impact of Government Spending on AD

content.question: The government of Euroland is considering increasing government spending to avoid a recession. What is the most likely effect on aggregate demand (AD) in Euroland?

choices.label: There will be a movement along the <math alttext="A D" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>AD</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> curve to a lower real output.
There will be a movement along the <math alttext="A D" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>AD</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> curve to a higher price level.
There will be no change in the <math alttext="A D" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>AD</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> curve.
There will be a leftward shift in the <math alttext="A D" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>AD</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> curve.
There will be a rightward shift in the <math alttext="A D" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>AD</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> curve.

content.answer: There will be a rightward shift in the <math alttext="A D" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>AD</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> curve.

skill.text: Skill 3.A: Determine the outcome of an economic situation using economic concepts, principles, or models.
